snippet: Secularism in India may be a noble but unnatural and unsustainable aspiration.
abstract: Secularism in India may be a noble but unnatural and unsustainable aspiration.
lead_paragraph: “In 1976, India made an amendment to its Constitution that inserted the word ‘secular’ to describe the great republic. It was a national aspiration and still is, and is glorified as a national characteristic, which it is not from the evidence in plain sight,” Manu Joseph wrote in The New York Times.

headline.main: Secularism in Search of a Nation
